result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Telephone scheduling conference on November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:05 PM (22CF33, 21CT28, 21TR583, 21TR596) Defendant Bryan C Kelly in court.  Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley in court for Bryan C Kelly.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Hurley summarizes the motion. Discussion held. State calls Deputy Scott Anderson, s/t. Cross examination by Atty Hurley. Redirect. Witness excused. Exhibit list prepared. Court heard. ADA Kunisch heard. Atty Hurley heard. Court finds the Refusal was improper. Administrative penalties through DOT. Sets TSC.
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on October 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Motion hearing on September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Based on Lack of Probable Cause

8:35 AM 22CF33, 21CT28, 21TR583, 596: Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryan C Kelly in court.  Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley in court for Bryan C Kelly. Review of info is waived; not guilty pleas entered; 30 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.

10:34 AM (22CF33/21CT28, 21TR583 & 596 tracking) Prosecuting Atty Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Bryan C Kelly in court. Attorney Robert Brendan Hurley appeared by phone means for Defendant Bryan C Kelly.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim  set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not be in a motor vehicle operated by anyone under the influence of any intoxicant.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.  Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
